page.title: 15Playing out at Fletchertown.
page.content: I come out of school at half past three and I walk home with Tracey,my friend.I ask her if she is going to play out after tea.She usually says yes and that she will come for me.I go into my house and throw my coat and bag on to the couch and then I have my tea. When Tracey comes we go out to play.Sometimes we play rounders and sometimes we play cricket.After a while I hear my mam shout'Sonia!'and that means I have to go in for my supper.I often have chips,sausage and pop to drink.I go out again when I have finished and then we play rounders at my auntie Elsie's corner, which is the corner between Coronation Terrace and South Street.We pick team and this is how we play.You hold the bat and someone throws the ball so you have to hit it and run round a square pitch before the ball is brought back.
